content: j r r tolkien mittens by tami these mittens were designed and knitted up just in time for j r r tolkien day january 3 the back features the symbol that tolkien created from his initials on the front is a simple recurring ring-like pattern i added a simple sword design on the thumb but this can be swapped out for the ring pattern if that is your preference this is a free pattern so feel free to customize it to suit your needs as long as it is not for commercial for-profit use gauge 14 row x 14 stitches = 2 inches in stranded knitting these mittens fit my hands 7 5 inches from top of wrist to tip of middle finger 3 5 inches across knuckles with some room materials 3 25 mm double pointed needles or circular needles for magic loop 1 ball of main dk weight yarn ~25 g 1 ball of contrasting dk weight yarn ~25 g waste yarn to hold thumb stitches needle to weave in ends instructions cast on 56 stitches for the cuff in cc join in the round join mc for corrugated ribbing or whatever is your preferred ribbing for 10 row or 1 add in mc and start main pattern keeping in mind the increases for the thumb gusset decreases start on row 53 ending with 10 stitches 5 on each side graft remaining stitches for the thumb i like to do a combination of thumb gusset and afterthought thumb technique as per pattern take note of the gusset increases then place 9 stitches on waste yarn to come back to once the rest of the mitten is completed place needles in the 18 stitches on both sides of the waste yarn and pick up 3 stitches on each side for a total of 24 thumb stitches note to avoid getting fingers stuck in loops of yarn on the finished mitten remember to keep floats down to a maximum of 4 stitches of the same color 64 63 62 61 60 59 58 57 56 55 54 53 main color 52
